In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = String[]
    
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= " " * word
    end
    
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here is an example of how to use this function:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit", 10))
```
This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet consectetur
adipiscing elit
```
